text: This is my dad. He is wearing a blue shirt. He used to work in a bank.
This is my wedding day. I was wearing a white dress, and my husband was in a black suit. It was a sunny day in June, and we were surrounded by family and friends.
These are my grandchildren, Emily and Jack. Emily loves to paint, and Jack plays football every weekend. We used to visit the park every Sunday together.
This is my childhood home. It was a small house with a red door and a large oak tree in the front yard. I grew up here with my two sisters and my parents.
This is the beach where I used to go on holidays every summer with my family. The sound of the waves and the smell of the ocean always bring back good memories.
This is my dog, Max. He was a golden retriever, and I used to take him for walks every morning. He loved playing fetch in the backyard.
This is our 25th wedding anniversary. We celebrated it at our favorite restaurant, with all our close friends and family. I remember the cake had roses made of sugar.
This is my old office. I worked here for 30 years as an accountant. My desk was always neat, and I enjoyed organizing company finances.
This is my son. He graduated from university with a degree in engineering. I remember how proud I was watching him walk across the stage to get his diploma.
This is my favorite restaurant where we used to go every Friday night. I always ordered the spaghetti, and the waiters knew our names. It was our special family tradition.
This is my first car. It was a blue Volkswagen Beetle. I bought it with my first paycheck, and I remember driving it down to the beach with my friends.
This is my garden. I used to spend hours planting flowers, especially tulips. My favorite was the red tulips, and they always bloomed in the spring.
This is the mountain cabin where we used to go on vacation. It was surrounded by pine trees, and at night, the stars were so bright. I remember roasting marshmallows by the fire.
This is a photo of our family reunion. It was the last time all of us were together, laughing and sharing stories. My sister made her famous apple pie that day.
This is my old school. I used to walk here every day. I remember playing on the swings during recess and how proud I felt when I graduated from this school.
These are my parents. My mother loved to bake, and my father was a teacher. I used to help my mother in the kitchen, and I remember my father's stories from his students.
This is a photo from our family vacation to Paris. We visited the Eiffel Tower, and I remember having coffee at a small caf√© by the river.
This is my graduation day from university. I wore a cap and gown, and my parents were there to support me. It was a big achievement for me.
This is our 40th wedding anniversary. We celebrated with a small gathering of close friends. I remember the beautiful bouquet of red roses my husband gave me.
This is the first house we bought together. It was a small, cozy home, and we spent our first Christmas here. I remember decorating the tree with homemade ornaments.
